hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
# Template1_20180824
# Get list of resources locked by this build. RESOURCES=${RESOURCES:-$(cd ${JENKINS_HOME} && ./resourceslockedby.py ${JOB_BASE_NAME}#${BUILD_NUMBER})}
TIMEOUT=3600
# Remove failure flags if any. rm -rf *.failed
# Run test on each resource. for R in ${RESOURCES}; do # In order to execute in parallel, each # ressource test run within its own subshell. ( # Reboot resource. (cd ${JENKINS_HOME} && ./rebootresource.sh jenkins@${R} &> /dev/null) echo "${R}: $(ssh -q jenkins@${R} 'uname -r')" > ${R}.kernelrelease timeout -sKILL ${TIMEOUT} ssh -q jenkins@${R} &> ${R}.ssh.log <<-EOF || touch ${R}.failed set -e sudo avocado run avocado-misc-tests/generic/ltp.py EOF AVOCADO_LOG_PATH=$(cat ${R}.ssh.log | fgrep 'JOB LOG' | grep -oP '(?<=: ).+$') if [ -n "${AVOCADO_LOG_PATH}" ]; then scp jenkins@${R}:${AVOCADO_LOG_PATH} ${R}.avocado.log fi ) & done
# Wait for all subshells. wait
# Generate "Kernel Release:" line for # the "Set Build Description" plugin. echo -n "Kernel Release: " > kernelreleases for R in ${RESOURCES}; do if [ -f ${R}.kernelrelease ]; then echo -n "$(cat ${R}.kernelrelease 2>/dev/null), " >> kernelreleases fi done truncate --size=-2 kernelreleases echo [$(cat kernelreleases)]
# This is the last command so as # to be the script exit status. test ! -e *.failed
